      • printPairsWithSum

        public static void printPairsWithSum(int[] arr,
                     int sum)
        Prints an array with the sum as passed as an argument to the function
        Logic is to keep a map. Now for each number, if the sum-number exists in the array, then returns the number and sum-i
        Else, add the sum-i to the map.
        Parameters:
        arr -
        sum -

      • timesFound

        public static int timesFound(char[][] arr,
             java.lang.String str)
        This program finds how many times a word occurs in a 2D array of characters
        Logic is simple back tracking.
        Parameters:
        arr - - array of 2D characters
        str - - string to be found
        Returns:
        - number of times the string is present in the 2D array

      • countTimes

        private static int countTimes(char[][] arr,
             int i,
             int j,
             char[] str,
             int current)
        Helper method for timesFound(char[][], String)
        The solution performs recursion. For each character, we look for next character in all four directions.
        Note that the solution can be expanded for all eight directions. But I have decided to keep it simple.
        Parameters:
        arr -
        i -
        j -
        str -
        current -
        Returns:
